Great video, but... There is a problem with the element argon and the calcium ion, whose radii are very close since an atomic species whose radius is an estimated value is being compared with ionic species whose values have been determined experimentally by measurements in crystalline networks. S2- (184pm) > Cl- (181pm) > K (138pm) > Ca2+ (100pm) > Ar (98pm). Thanks for your videos.
